III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Rules compliance
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4104
Section (2) After being licensed, an institution shall, on an ongoing basis,
Description comply with the act, child caring institution rules, and terms of the
license.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation There are hundreds of youths placed at Calumet.
Investigation Complainant was anonymous.
Program Director was interviewed during an unannounced visit
to the facility on 2/7/2025. The program director reported that the
census for today is 36. The facility sends out the census every
morning via email and also posts it on the staff board located by
the front entrance.
Licensee Designee was interviewed during an unannounced visit
to the facility on 2/7/2025. The licensee designee reported the
census is around 38 youth at Calumet. He also reported “his
operation status” is 8 youth per pod, which is 64 youth in each
building, and this is the max he would prefer to have. He stated he
does not want the agency to be at max licensing capacity.
Licensee Designee also reported the agency has never operated
outside of their licensing capacity and the highest amount of youth
they have had at one time, was 40.
Staff 1 was interviewed during an unannounced visit to the facility
on 2/7/2025. Staff 1 reported he has never seen the facility have
100 youth. The most he has seen is around 30 youth and the
lowest was approximately 25 youth. Staff 1 also reported today’s
census (roughly 30 youth) is the highest the facility has had since
he’s been working at the facility.
Staff 2 was interviewed during an unannounced visit to the facility
on 2/7/2025. Staff 2 reported she has never seen Calumet have
100 youth placed at one time. She reported the current census is
around 40 youth or under. When she first started working, about
five and a half years ago, the facility was fully staffed, and every
pod was open and running and believed the agency had
approximately 80 youth placed at that time.
2

Staff 3 was interviewed during an unannounced visit to the facility
on 2/7/2025. Staff 3 reported she has been working at the agency
for roughly a year and since she has started, there have been
roughly 30 youth placed. She also stated the agency does not
have 100 youth placed with them.
Documentation reviewed:
• Facility census dated for 2/7/2025 was reviewed.
Census count is listed as 36.
• This facility has a maximum capacity of 88 youth per their
licensing terms.
Analysis The agency is in compliance as per staff interviews and
documentation reviewed of the facility census report, the agency
is operating within their licensing capacity terms.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
